results.description: The Pre-College Scholars Program is designed to recruit talented high school students to the A. James Clark School of Engineering by focusing on those with an interest in mathematics, science, and engineering. Open to rising juniors and seniors in Maryland and Washington, D.C., with a minimum 3.5 GPA, the curriculum includes extensive SAT preparation in small classroom settings and workshops on college admissions and financial aid. Over the course of three weeks, participants receive approximately 49 hours of instruction, including departmental presentations from eight engineering departments and one-on-one assistance with the college application process. Students are required to attend all sessions, including mandatory orientation and pre- and post-tests, while utilizing personal laptops and online resources from the College Board and Khan Academy. The program cost is $400 per student, with scholarships available based on demonstrated financial need to ensure accessibility for qualified applicants.

results.name: Pre-College
results.title: The Upward Bound Program
results.subtitle: Pre-College Programs
results.description: The Upward Bound Program is a federally funded and state-supported educational initiative designed to provide academic and counseling services to students in preparation for post-secondary education. The initiative supplements the secondary school experience by creating opportunities for academic, social, and emotional development through both summer and academic year sessions. Participants can engage in robotics classes to learn fundamental programming and coding for Sphero Robots, as well as utilize 24/7 tutoring via Photostudy for subjects ranging from Algebra to SAT preparation. The program also offers access to mind mapping software to assist with research papers, citations, and assignment timelines to enhance college readiness. These comprehensive services are designed to mitigate economic and social inequities while maintaining high student retention and persistence rates.

results.name: Summer Science Academy
results.title: Summer Science Academy
results.subtitle: Emory School of Medicine
results.description: The Summer Science Academy is a two-week science enrichment day program designed for incoming 9th and 10th grade students interested in healthcare and STEM fields. Participants engage in a series of hands-on lectures, laboratory sessions, and field experiences that explore topics such as biotechnology, natural science, and medical research. The program is led by qualified medical students, health professionals, and teachers who focus on introducing fundamental scientific principles and various career paths in science. This non-residential academy operates from 9:00 am to 3:30 pm on weekdays, and while all learning supplies are provided, students are responsible for bringing their own daily lunches. Registration requires the completion of liability and media release forms, with enrollment fees payable via major credit cards.

results.name: AggieSTEM

deadlines.label: Last day to submit roommate requests
Last Day to submit Scholarship Applications

program_dates.label: Aggie STEM 2026 AI + Lesson Study Immersive PD

results.title: Aggie STEM
results.subtitle: A collaboration between Texas A&M’s College of Education and Human Development and the faculty of the College of Engineering
results.description: Aggie STEM offers a variety of summer programs, including overnight camps for middle and high school students as well as day camps for elementary students. These camps focus on project-based learning in diverse fields such as engineering design, advanced technological tools, and mathematical modeling. In addition to student-focused sessions, the program provides an immersive professional development opportunity for educators to integrate artificial intelligence tools into their teaching frameworks. Participants engage in classes led by STEM professionals and university faculty, exploring real-world scientific problems through hands-on activities. The curriculum is designed to encourage advanced students to explore STEM-related fields while building lasting connections through interactive social events.

results.name: PME University of Chicago
results.title: Summer Lab and Research Experiences
results.subtitle: Pritzker School of Molecular Engineering
results.description: The UChicago PME hosts a variety of summer programs designed for participants to engage in authentic, immersive, and intensive mentored research experiences. These opportunities cater to a wide audience including undergraduate students looking to advance research skills, community college students exploring STEM degrees, high school teachers interested in quantum technologies, and high school students ready for real-world research. Specific offerings include the Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU), the City Colleges of Chicago Summer Program, the After School Matters STEM Lab Internship, and the TeachQuantum program. Participants receive structured and formal mentorship to support their learning within a professional laboratory environment. These initiatives focus on providing exposure to emerging technologies and practical applications while fostering professional development in scientific fields.

results.name: Yale Global Scholars
results.title: Yale Young Global Scholars
results.subtitle: Yale University
results.description: Yale Young Global Scholars is an academic enrichment program designed for outstanding high school students from across the globe. Participants select from interdisciplinary tracks including Innovations in Science & Technology, Politics of Law & Economics, and Solving Global Challenges. The program brings together a diverse cohort of students representing over 150 countries and all 50 U.S. states to form a global learning community. Students engage in rigorous academic activities such as lectures and collaborative sessions focused on addressing complex issues through a multi-faceted lens. This residential experience allows scholars to immerse themselves in an environment that prioritizes intellectual growth and meaningful international connections.

results.name: Summer Scholars
results.title: Summer Scholars
results.subtitle: University of Notre Dame
results.description: Summer Scholars participants spend two intensive weeks taking a challenging college-level course taught by University of Notre Dame faculty. The program maintains small class sizes to ensure high levels of personal attention while providing a rigorous and rewarding preview of college academics. Students may earn one transferable college credit upon the completion of a program track and are expected to collaborate on coursework outside of designated class times. Beyond the classroom, participants engage in the social facets of college life and have opportunities to participate in community service projects.

results.name: Future Leaders Program
results.title: Future Leaders Summer Program
results.subtitle: UC San Diego School of Global Policy and Strategy
results.description: This immersive program invites domestic and international high school students entering 10th through 12th grade to develop critical diplomacy and problem-solving skills focused on global affairs. Participants select a specialized track in climate crisis, artificial intelligence, digital influence, or energy innovation to research real-world leaders and represent their perspectives in hands-on negotiations. Throughout the experience, students work in small teams to analyze global data, develop actionable solutions, and produce a collaborative action research report. In addition to attending lectures from renowned scholars and visiting world-class research labs, attendees earn one unit of pre-collegiate credit and reside in campus dormitories while building a network of peers interested in social impact. The curriculum concludes with a formal final presentation day where teams share their innovative ideas with the broader community and invited guests.

results.name: Nurse Camp
results.title: Early Outreach
results.subtitle: University of Nevada, Las Vegas
results.description: UNLV Early Outreach provides college and career readiness programming specifically designed for K–10 students and their families. The initiative helps participants navigate their path to college through community programming that includes school visits for college fairs, career days, and family nights. Students can participate in year-round events focused on building curiosity about future careers and connecting with university and community partners. Additionally, the Young Rebels component offers academic and social enrichment where students engage in critical thinking and interact directly with university faculty and students. These varied engagement opportunities aim to help students envision themselves in a higher education setting while building academically minded friendships.

results.name: Pathways Research Internship
results.title: Yale Pathways Research Internships
results.subtitle: Yale University
results.description: Yale Pathways Research Internships (YPRI) connects qualified public high school students with scientific research labs for a seven-week summer program. These research experiences are designed to excite students about scientific investigation while enabling them to explore various new scientific fields. The initiative aims to increase college preparedness among participants and foster long-term relationships between laboratories and students enthusiastic about pursuing careers in research. Participating interns gain valuable exposure to the professional scientific environment by working directly in host labs.

results.name: TRIO Upward Bound Math & Science
results.title: Upward Bound Math & Science Center
results.subtitle: University of Nevada, Las Vegas
results.description: The Upward Bound Math & Science Center is a federally funded college preparatory program designed for first-generation and income-qualified students between the ages of 13 and 19. This free program focuses on identifying and motivating participants from select target high schools to complete secondary education and graduate from post-secondary institutions. Students receive comprehensive support during the academic year, including specialized instruction in math and science, tutoring, ACT/SAT preparation, and career exploration. Additionally, participants can engage in a six-week summer residential program that offers a university life experience, rigorous STEAM curriculum, and opportunities for mentorship with faculty and internships.

results.name: Reflections Competition
results.title: Reflections Arts Program
results.subtitle: National PTA
results.description: The Reflections Arts Program is a long-standing arts education initiative that invites students in pre-K through grade 12 to explore their thoughts and develop artistic literacy. Participants create original works of art based on an annual student-selected theme across six categories: Dance Choreography, Film Production, Literature, Music Composition, Photography, and Visual Arts. The program offers several participation levels including Primary, Intermediate, Middle School, High School, and an Accessible Arts division designed specifically for students with disabilities. Successful entries move from local PTA units through state levels to reach the national competition, where students are eligible for recognition such as the Award of Excellence and the Award of Outstanding Interpretation.

results.name: Bentley University
results.title: Analytics Academy
results.subtitle: Bentley University
results.description: Bentley's Analytics Academy is a week-long pre-college program designed for rising juniors and seniors in high school to explore the vast potential of data. Participants gain insights into the world of data sciences through engaging presentations from guest speakers and intensive hands-on learning opportunities. Students work on a comprehensive capstone project that allows them to apply their newly acquired skills and knowledge to a real-world setting. The curriculum focuses on developing practical data analytics skills while ensuring a positive and discovery-oriented environment for all attendees. Under the guidance of experienced instructors, the program emphasizes both theoretical discovery and the practical application of data-driven insights.

results.name: YTI Online
results.title: YTI Online
results.subtitle: Emory Youth Theological Initiative
results.description: YTI Online is a program designed for youth to engage in weekly one-hour discussions centered around significant theological and social questions. Participants explore topics such as justice, the Bible, and ways to improve the world through shared reading materials provided by the initiative. The group is student-driven, allowing members to decide how the program proceeds and which books are selected for study. Facilitated by adults who engage with participants as equals, the program offers a supportive space for asking complex questions about faith and society. Although the program is currently on hiatus, it remains focused on fostering an environment where all inquiries are considered essential to the development of a healthy faith.

results.name: Summer Journalism

deadlines.label: Application deadline for U.S. and online visiting students for Session 2 (recommended)

results.title: Summer Journalism @ NYU
results.subtitle: Arthur L. Carter Journalism Institute
results.description: Summer Journalism @ NYU offers a variety of intensive credit-bearing courses for high school rising juniors and seniors, visiting undergraduate students, and lifelong learners. Participants can enroll in two- or four-credit classes covering specialized topics such as fashion industry reporting, newsroom production, and film journalism. The precollege track allows high school students to experience university life while earning credits, while the visiting student program welcomes international applicants and working professionals. Prospective students must submit an online application once the portal opens, with international participants required to demonstrate strong English proficiency due to the writing-intensive nature of the curriculum. On-campus housing is available for students, though it is important to note that financial aid is not offered to those in the visiting student category.

results.name: USA Computing Olympiad
results.title: USACO
results.subtitle: USACO
results.description: The USACO identifies, motivates, and trains high school students in computing through a series of online programming contests and educational resources. This program features four levels of competition—bronze, silver, gold, and platinum—allowing participants to progress as they improve their programming and computational problem-solving skills. A certified scoring system is implemented in advanced divisions to provide high credibility for results used in determining promotion and further selection. Top-performing students are invited to a proctored championship contest and an intensive summer training camp for advanced instruction and team selection. Based on these results, the organization selects representatives for prestigious international competitions, including the International Olympiad in Informatics and the European Girls' Olympiad in Informatics. Additionally, the program provides hundreds of hours of free online training resources and historical contest problems with solutions to support student learning worldwide.

results.name: Summer Seminar
results.title: Summer Programs
results.subtitle: U.S. Naval Academy
results.description: The Summer Programs at the U.S. Naval Academy provide students entering grades 9 through 12 with the opportunity to experience academic, athletic, and professional training in a collegiate environment. The Summer Seminar specifically targets rising 12th graders, offering a taste of life at the Academy while helping participants kick-start their official application process during a week of immersive training. For younger students, the Summer STEM program focuses on rising 9th to 11th graders interested in problem-solving, exploratory learning, and critical thinking within technical fields like science and technology. Throughout these sessions, attendees from around the world engage in team-building exercises and develop lifelong friendships while exploring the various majors and career opportunities available at the institution. These programs are designed to help prospective candidates understand the unique challenges and rewards of a Naval Academy education through hands-on activities and peer collaboration.

results.name: R Programming & Machine Learning Camp
results.title: 2026 ACB Camp
results.subtitle: miRcore
results.description: The Advanced Computational Biology Camp, offered to academically motivated high school and exceptional 8th-grade students, is a research-intensive program focused on identifying cancer biomarkers using microRNA expression data. Participants utilize the R programming language and machine learning packages to analyze big data from The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) and generate professional scientific graphics for publications or science fairs. Students with varying levels of coding experience are grouped together to develop individual research projects while receiving support from multiple teaching assistants. The program requires active engagement in both technical learning and group activities, culminating in a Friday presentation of research projects developed throughout the week. Interested applicants must submit an essay for review and pay an application fee, with limited partial scholarships available for those demonstrating financial need.

results.name: GSTEM Online Data Science
results.title: GSTEM Online Data Science Course
results.subtitle: NYU
results.description: The GSTEM Online Data Science Course is a non-credit program designed for 11th and 12th-grade students with a strong academic background and a demonstrated interest in STEM fields. Developed and taught by NYU professors, the curriculum allows students to gain proficiency in gathering, processing, analyzing, and visualizing data using Python and mathematical principles. Participants engage in lectures featuring special guest speakers, including professional data scientists and prominent women in STEM. To be eligible for admission, applicants must have completed or be currently enrolled in Pre-Calculus and an introductory computer science course such as AP Computer Science Principles. The program costs $2,500 and requires an online application that includes high school transcripts and two short essay responses.

results.name: Terp Young Scholars
results.title: Terp Young Scholars
results.subtitle: University of Maryland Extended Studies
results.description: The Terp Young Scholars program offers a transformative three-week pre-college experience for high school students from rising grade 10 through graduating grade 12. Participants have the opportunity to earn three university credits while exploring new academic fields and connecting with experienced faculty members. The program provides flexible learning options, including an immersive campus experience and interactive virtual classes that can be completed online from any location. This rigorous environment is designed to challenge students' academic curiosity and provide a realistic introduction to the expectations of university-level coursework.

results.name: International Relations Academy
results.title: International Relations Academy
results.subtitle: Georgetown University School of Continuing Studies
results.description: The International Relations Academy offers high school students a comprehensive one-week immersive experience exploring global issues and contemporary foreign policy challenges. Participants learn directly from world-renowned faculty, specialists, and practitioners through a blend of academic lectures, off-site visits, and hands-on activities. The curriculum covers diverse subject areas such as international law, the instruments of foreign policy, intelligence, and the future of the international system. Students engage in small discussion groups to examine in-depth issues and participate in a collaborative international crisis simulation. Upon successful completion of the program, every participant receives a Certificate of Participation.

results.name: Summer Session
results.title: Summer Session
results.subtitle: Rutgers–New Brunswick
results.description: Summer Session at Rutgers–New Brunswick provides an opportunity for students to get ahead on degree credits through a diverse array of academic offerings. Participants can choose from more than 1,600 courses, including internships, travel opportunities, and specialized research experiences. The program is designed to accommodate a variety of learners, specifically current Rutgers students, visiting students, international participants, and pre-college scholars. Enrolled individuals can utilize numerous university resources, including financial aid, scholarships, and the Office of the Registrar to manage their academic progress.

results.name: Engineering Program
results.title: Engineering Summer Program
results.subtitle: Institute for STEM Education (I-STEM)
results.description: The Engineering Summer Program, offered by the Institute for STEM Education (I-STEM), is designed for high school students who have completed at least the ninth grade. Participants explore the fundamentals of digital electronics and physical computing through hands-on labs using the Arduino Microcontroller. Throughout the course, students learn to program microcontrollers, wire electronic components, and use analog signals to control devices like sensors and motors. No prior experience in programming or electronics is necessary for enrollment, though the curriculum remains technically rigorous and focuses on real-world engineering challenges involving motors and driver boards. The program concludes with a student-designed final project where participants build automated mechanisms or smart devices to demonstrate their problem-solving and engineering design skills. Interested students must submit an application form along with recommendation forms from both a math and a science teacher.

results.name: Oakland University
results.title: Emerging Scholars Program
results.subtitle: Oakland University
results.description: The Emerging Scholars Program at Oakland University offers a two-semester conditional admission to high school students who demonstrate academic strength but do not meet general admission requirements. To remain in the program, students must enroll full-time in both fall and winter semesters and successfully complete at least 67 percent of their attempted credits. Academic standards for participants include earning a minimum of 28 credits during the first year and maintaining a cumulative GPA of 2.0 or higher. Participants are further required to attend new student orientation, engage in mandatory advising sessions, and meet with a success coach on a weekly basis. Students must also enroll in Collegiate Communication (COM 1100) to foster essential academic skills and prepare for full admission to the university.

results.name: ChemiCo
results.title: ChemiCo
results.subtitle: StemCo
results.description: ChemiCo is an international Olympiad-style Chemistry competition that operates as part of the broader StemCo framework. This program is specifically designed to catalyze the discovery and development of student competencies through expertly crafted assessment tools. Participation is open to secondary school students ranging from grades 7 to 12 with no specific age restrictions. The competition is accessible to a global audience and is offered in several languages, including English, Russian, French, Portuguese, and Romanian. Participants have the opportunity to utilize sample questions and a syllabus outline to prepare for the challenge of competing against peers internationally.

results.name: Scripps College of Communication
results.title: High School Media Workshop
results.subtitle: Ohio University
results.description: The High School Media Workshop offers aspiring creatives a hands-on opportunity to explore various production paths including video production, animation, music technology, and audio for cinema. Participants work alongside university professors and current students to create original projects using professional studios and lab equipment. This overnight residential experience includes lodging in university residence halls and meals in dining facilities to provide a complete taste of campus life. Throughout the program, students gain technical skills in digital cinematography and post-production while building community with like-minded peers from across the country. All skill levels are welcome to participate in this immersive environment designed to help future media professionals find their creative direction.

results.name: The Cutting-Edge of Biological Discovery
results.title: Biology: The Science of Cells and Innovation
results.subtitle: Georgetown University
results.description: This online biology program for students ages 13 and older examines cellular frameworks, microscopy, and the intersection of cell organization and human disease. Students select from two modalities: a 20- to 30-hour enrichment track or a 128-hour college credit track that recommends high school biology as a prerequisite. Both options feature 100% online flexible video lessons from university faculty, dedicated mentorship from TAs, and a final capstone project to demonstrate mastery of course material. Depending on the chosen track, participants earn either a certificate of completion or a formal Georgetown transcript with a letter grade for their academic work.

results.name: Girls in Math
results.title: Yale Math Competitions
results.subtitle: Yale
results.description: Yale Math Competitions involves a series of academic events focused on the field of mathematics. The program provides an opportunity for students to engage with challenging problems that test their quantitative and analytical abilities. Participants can showcase their mathematical skills in a competitive environment designed to promote academic growth. These competitions are associated with Yale and aim to foster a community of students interested in the mathematical sciences.

results.name: Filmmakers Workshop
results.title: Tisch Online High School Filmmakers Workshop
results.subtitle: NYU Tisch School of the Arts
results.description: The Tisch Online High School Filmmakers Workshop provides high school freshmen, sophomores, juniors, and seniors with the opportunity to develop professional skills in writing, directing, shooting, and editing. Students participate in an asynchronous learning environment, watching pre-recorded video lectures at their own pace while completing daily or weekly assignments on the Smashcut platform. Throughout the program, participants produce a variety of short films, including a crew-based documentary, a music video, and a final narrative film. While students must supply their own filming technology and computer equipment, they engage in real-time video meetings with instructors and film crews to foster collaboration. Upon successful completion of the workshop, students earn four college credits and receive instruction from a faculty of experienced industry professionals.

results.name: University of Cincinnati
results.title: Medical Sciences Summer Institute
results.subtitle: University of Cincinnati College of Medicine
results.description: The Medical Sciences Summer Institute offers immersive summer workshops for rising high school juniors and seniors interested in medicine, healthcare, and biomedical research. Participants can choose from specialized tracks focusing on molecular biology, cellular topics, or medical informatics, which includes instruction on artificial intelligence and data science. The curriculum provides hands-on experience in a state-of-the-art environment, covering areas such as recombinant DNA, gene expression, and machine learning using healthcare data. Admission to the program requires a resume highlighting academic and leadership history, a personal statement, and a fee of $1100, though limited scholarships and financial aid are available to eligible applicants. Applicants must be at least 16 years old by the program start date to participate in these week-long full-day sessions.
